**TL;DR formula for the chance of a win/loss streak:  your average winrate to the power of the number of games.**
50% winrate
0.5^1 = 0.5
0.5^2 = 0.25
0.5^3 = 0.125
0.5^4 = 0.0625

70% winrate:
0.7^2 = 0.49
0.7^3 = 0.343
0.7^4 = 0.2401
0.7^8 = 0.05764801 (5.7%, compared to 0.3% for 50% winrate, almost 20 times more likely)

It looks like you have not stopped and thought about why it is impossible in LoL, or are simply unable to handle that sort of logic.. most people cannot, for some reason.

What about the simpler explanation, that you have a roughly 50% chance of winning any game? The chances of a win/loss streak continuing past a certain point are very low.

Your chance of winning or loosing one game is 50%, give or take a little based on skill.
Your chance of winning or loosing two games in a row is half that.
Three, half that again.
Win/loss streaks are easily represented with binary numbers, as well.
8 binary bits (win/loss) can hold 256 possible values, of which only one is 8 straight wins: 1 out of 256 or 0.390625% chance in any sequence of 8 games.
7 out of 8 has 8 out of 256 possible combinations, or a 1/32 (3.125%) chance of happening in any 8 games.

Naturally, your ELO/MRR and what champion you are playing has a huge impact on these, i once (and have never seen another over 8 since) got a 14-win streak in normal games playing a champion i was highly skilled with, but i also had a 75% winrate with that champion, which massively increases the chance of longer streaks). 

These are not about league, but statistical math is the same everywhere. If you can understand them, you will understand why this is silly.
